document.masterDocTitle: Holomorphology and Neotype designation of Microperla geei Chu, with egg morphology of Microperla qinlinga Chen (Plecoptera: Peltoperlidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Holomorphology and Neotype designation of Microperla geei Chu, with egg morphology of Microperla qinlinga Chen (Plecoptera: Peltoperlidae)

mods:name.mods:affiliation: School of Grain Science and Technology, Jiangsu University of Science and Technology, Zhenjiang 212004, China 741208116 @ qq. com; https: // orcid. org / 0000 - 0002 - 6331 - 8978

bibRefCitation.author: Chu, Y. T.
bibRefCitation.refString: Chu, Y. T. (1928) Descriptions of a new genus and three new species of stone-flies from Hangchow. The China Journal, 9 (4), 194 - 198.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Microperla geei Chu, 1928
. China J. 9(4): 197; Wu, 1938 . Plecopterum sinensium, a monograph of the stoneflies of China (Order Plecoptera ): 67; Illies, 1966 . Das Tierreich 82: 19; Wu, 1973 . Acta Ent. Sin. 16(2): 97; Stark & Sivec, 2000 . Acta Entomol. Sloven. 8: 102.

Type information.
Holotype : male, China : Zhejiang Province , Fu Bao (Hu Pao Quan), Hangchow (Hangzhou City), China (lost, Wu 1962 )
. Paratype : one female, same locality and data as holotype (lost, Wu 1962 ).

Material examined.
Neotype herein designated: male, China : Zhejiang Province , Hangzhou City , Tianmu Mountain , Tianmu Stream ( Figs. 1 , 2 ), 30.3604 N , 119.4434 E ,
580 m
,
5 April 2020
, leg. Zhi-Teng Chen , Xu-Hong- Yi Zheng & Zhen-Xing Ma (ICJUST)
.
Paratypes : 7 males , 17 females , one larva, one exuvia, same locality and data as holotype (ICJUST)
.

caption.paragraph: FIGURE 1. Geographical locations of Tianmu Mountain and Hupaoquan in Hangzhou City, Zhejiang Province, China.

subSubSection.paragraph: Male. Body ( Fig. 3 ) length ca. 6.5 mm (n = 8). Body generally dark brown. Head ( Fig. 4 ) with a dark median area. Triocellate, but anterior ocellus largely reduced; compound eyes small rounded and protruded. Antennae slen- der and dark brown. Pronotum rectangular with obtuse corners, median area dark pigmented and laterally with several dark spots on lateral pale areas; posteromedial margin of pronotum pale. Meso- and metanota mostly dark brown. Macropterous ( Fig. 5 ); wings hairy and subhyaline, veins pale brown. Wing venation generally identical to that in Chu (1928) , except for the one or two extra crossveins beyond Sc. Legs generally pale brown, joints dark.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 2.
Microperla geei Chu, 1928
. A. Xu-Hong-Yi Zheng and Zhen-Xing Ma collecting stoneflies in the habitat stream, Tianmu Stream; B. detritus habitat of the larva; C. fresh exuvia on a stone; D–E. adult habitus when alive.

FIGURE 3.
Microperla geei Chu, 1928
. A. male habitus, dorsal view; B. male habitus, ventral view.

FIGURE 4.
Microperla geei Chu, 1928
. A. male head and prothorax, dorsal view; B. male head and prothorax, ventral view.

FIGURE 5.
Microperla geei Chu, 1928
. A. right forewing, dorsal view; B. right hind wing, dorsal view.

FIGURE 6.
Microperla geei Chu, 1928
. A. male abdomen, dorsal view; B. male abdomen, lateral view; C. male abdomen, ventral view.

subSubSection.paragraph: Female. Body ( Fig. 8 ) length ca. 7 mm (n = 17). Color pattern similar to males ( Figs. 8 , 9A ). Abdominal tergum 10 slightly projected backwards ( Fig. 9A ). Subgenital plate large and broad, bilobed with a shallow posterior notch or truncate at posterior margin, covering half of sternum 9 ( Fig. 9B, C ).

Larva. Body length ca. 6.5 mm ( Figs. 10 , 11 ). Head mostly pale, medially with a brown stigma covering ocelli ( Fig. 12A ); compound eyes dark and glabrous; margins and submargins of head with long pale spines. Antennae pale and slender ( Fig. 12 B–E), subequal to body length, each segment apically fringed with moderate cylindrical spines. Glossae of labium longer than paraglossae, similar to that in Huo & Du (2019) . Stipes of maxilla with granules along outer margin ( Fig. 13A, B ); galea broad, inner margin with a row of stout apical spines, apex with a huge crescent hairbrush on ventral aspect; lacinia long triangular, with several apical teeth and an inner comb of marginal spines. Mandible with three blunt main teeth ( Fig. 13C, D ), ventral aspect with a huge hairbrush, dorsal aspect with a marginal comb of thick spines posterior to the main teeth; molar area pale.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 7.
Microperla geei Chu, 1928
. A. male terminalia, dorsal view; B. male terminalia, lateral view; C. aedeagus, dorsal view; D. aedeagus, lateral view; E. aedeagus, ventral view.

subSubSection.paragraph: Egg. Shape typical for Peltoperlidae ( Fig. 16 ), both dorsal and ventral aspects flat, diameter approximately 0.3 mm . Irregular follicle cell impressions present on chorionic surface except for the circular lid, inner area of which unmodified ( Fig. 16C, D ).

Remarks. Chen & Song (2019) concluded that wing venation, shape and size of the ventral lobe of the male, shape and extent of the subgenital plate of the female and egg morphology are currently utilized characters for specific identification of
Microperla
. However, that study found the conspecific variations concerning the width of ventral lobe and shape of sternum 9 in the male; this study also revealed intraspecific variations on subgenital plate of the female and interspecific similarity of terminalia and wing venation. Fortunately, details of aedeagus and egg morphology are diagnostic among the currently named and completely described species.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 8.
Microperla geei
Chu, 1928
. A. female habitus, dorsal view; B. female habitus, ventral view.

subSubSection.paragraph:
The newly designated Neotype is generally identical to the original descriptions of Chu (1928) , despite the variable width of male ventral lobe and shape of the female subgenital plate. Wing venation of the Neotype is almost identical with the original descriptions of
M. geei
except for the number of crossveins beyond Sc and between M and CuP, whereas it is similar to the venation of
M. qinlinga
. The abdominal tergum 9 of the Neotype is notched at posterior margin, but was shown as complete in Chu (1928) and in the supposed redescription in Stark & Sivec (2000) . The aedeagus of
M. geei
is newly described, clearly different from that of
M. qinlinga
( Chen & Song 2019 , Huo & Du 2019 ). Larva of
M. geei
is apparently different from
M. qinlinga
by showing different body color and details of mouthparts ( Huo & Du 2019 ). Egg morphology of the newly studied material apparently differs from that provided by Stark & Sivec (2000) in showing no cell impressions on the circular lid. The
Microperla
species described by Stark & Sivec (2000) from Henan Province is not conspecific with
M. geei
.
